text: Family Member: Okay. Doctor: There could either be zero or there could be some somewhere. It’s just not enough for it to be detectible. Family Member: Okay. Doctor: So therefore getting a CAT scan, bone scan, it doesn’t, it’s kind of a waste of time because even if something’s there it’s not enough to actually be seen. Family Member: Be seen, okay. Doctor: On a scan. Family Member: So it doesn’t mean there’s nothing there, it just means it won’t be picked up. Doctor: Right. Family Member: Okay. Patient: And I’ll I think my last PSA was somewhere like around three five, three six something like that. Now what value or number would you consider going in towards scans? Doctor: One or two. Patient: Okay.

Doctor-Patient-Conversation-Analysis-pos.text: Thank you for your valuable contributions to our study! Our goal is to understand how doctors can communicate better with patients by looking at different perceptions of the doctors’ qualities. Understanding your personal experiences with the medical system will help us to contextualize your responses. We invite you to share insights by answering the following questions. Your answers to these questions are strictly confidential and anonymous.
